alert.note: Alert for Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:09PM EST until February 18 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Bracken, Lewis, Mason and Robertson. In Ohio, Adams, Brown, Highland, Pike, Ross and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 809 PM EST, radar showed that heavy rain was tapering off. However, areal flooding is still ongoing and is expected to continue into tonight. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chillicothe, Portsmouth, Maysville, Hillsboro, Greenfield, Georgetown, Waverly, Wheelersburg, Washington, Mount Orab, West Union, New Boston, Piketon, Manchester, Peebles, Ripley, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Lynchburg and Leesburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
